            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<span class="line"><!---->While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<!----></span><br><br>     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<span class="line"><!---->     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<!----></span><br>     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<span class="line"><!---->     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<!----></span><br>     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<span class="line"><!---->     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<!----></span><br>     4:          Source source,<span class="line"><!---->     4:          Source source,<!----></span><br>     5:          bool succeeded) {<span class="line"><!---->     5:          bool succeeded) {<!----></span><br>     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<span class="line"><!---->     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<!----></span><br>     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<span class="line"><!---->     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<!----></span><br>     8:      if (id == -1)<span class="line"><!---->     8:      if (id == -1)<!----></span><br>     9:          return;<span class="line"><!---->     9:          return;<!----></span><br>    10:      String value =<span class="line"><!---->    10:      String value =<!----></span><br>    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate->SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<span class="line"><!---->    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate-&gt;SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<!----></span><br>    12:          (candidate->SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate->SdpMLineIndex())<span class="line"><!---->    12:          (candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex())<!----></span><br>    13:                                      : "null") +<span class="line"><!---->    13:                                      : "null") +<!----></span><br>    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate->Candidate());<span class="line"><!---->    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate-&gt;Candidate());<!----></span><br><br>When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <span class="line"><!---->When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <!----></span><br><br>In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<span class="line"><!---->In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<!----></span><br>In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<span class="line"><!---->In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<!----></span><br>Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>### ==26232==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br><br>A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: &lt;Copy from: 'about:version'&gt;  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<span class="line"><!---->I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<!----></span><br><br>I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<!----></span><br><br>tommi@: can you please take a look at this? Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), govind@(iOS), geohsu@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), govind@(iOS), geohsu@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<span class="line"><!---->While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<!----></span><br><br>     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<span class="line"><!---->     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<!----></span><br>     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<span class="line"><!---->     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<!----></span><br>     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<span class="line"><!---->     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<!----></span><br>     4:          Source source,<span class="line"><!---->     4:          Source source,<!----></span><br>     5:          bool succeeded) {<span class="line"><!---->     5:          bool succeeded) {<!----></span><br>     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<span class="line"><!---->     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<!----></span><br>     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<span class="line"><!---->     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<!----></span><br>     8:      if (id == -1)<span class="line"><!---->     8:      if (id == -1)<!----></span><br>     9:          return;<span class="line"><!---->     9:          return;<!----></span><br>    10:      String value =<span class="line"><!---->    10:      String value =<!----></span><br>    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate->SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<span class="line"><!---->    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate-&gt;SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<!----></span><br>    12:          (candidate->SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate->SdpMLineIndex())<span class="line"><!---->    12:          (candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex())<!----></span><br>    13:                                      : "null") +<span class="line"><!---->    13:                                      : "null") +<!----></span><br>    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate->Candidate());<span class="line"><!---->    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate-&gt;Candidate());<!----></span><br><br>When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <span class="line"><!---->When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <!----></span><br><br>In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<span class="line"><!---->In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<!----></span><br>In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<span class="line"><!---->In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<!----></span><br>Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>### --no-sandbox poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<!----></span><br>ASAN information Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->ASAN ==26232==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br><br>A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: &lt;Copy from: 'about:version'&gt;  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<span class="line"><!---->I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<!----></span><br><br>I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<!----></span><br><br>tommi@: can you please take a look at this? Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<span class="line"><!---->While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<!----></span><br><br>     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<span class="line"><!---->     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<!----></span><br>     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<span class="line"><!---->     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<!----></span><br>     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<span class="line"><!---->     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<!----></span><br>     4:          Source source,<span class="line"><!---->     4:          Source source,<!----></span><br>     5:          bool succeeded) {<span class="line"><!---->     5:          bool succeeded) {<!----></span><br>     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<span class="line"><!---->     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<!----></span><br>     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<span class="line"><!---->     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<!----></span><br>     8:      if (id == -1)<span class="line"><!---->     8:      if (id == -1)<!----></span><br>     9:          return;<span class="line"><!---->     9:          return;<!----></span><br>    10:      String value =<span class="line"><!---->    10:      String value =<!----></span><br>    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate->SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<span class="line"><!---->    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate-&gt;SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<!----></span><br>    12:          (candidate->SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate->SdpMLineIndex())<span class="line"><!---->    12:          (candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex())<!----></span><br>    13:                                      : "null") +<span class="line"><!---->    13:                                      : "null") +<!----></span><br>    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate->Candidate());<span class="line"><!---->    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate-&gt;Candidate());<!----></span><br><br>When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <span class="line"><!---->When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <!----></span><br><br>In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<span class="line"><!---->In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<!----></span><br>In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<span class="line"><!---->In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<!----></span><br>Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>### Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->### Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>Command line :<span class="line"><!---->Command line :<!----></span><br>    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<!----></span><br>ASAN information Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->ASAN information Windows 10 x64<!----></span><br><br>    =================================================================<span class="line"><!----> ==26232==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br><br>A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: &lt;Copy from: 'about:version'&gt;  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M93's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M93's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Marcin! The VRP Panel had decided to award you $22,000 for this report.           padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<span class="line"><!---->While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<!----></span><br><br>     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<span class="line"><!---->     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<!----></span><br>     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<span class="line"><!---->     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<!----></span><br>     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<span class="line"><!---->     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<!----></span><br>     4:          Source source,<span class="line"><!---->     4:          Source source,<!----></span><br>     5:          bool succeeded) {<span class="line"><!---->     5:          bool succeeded) {<!----></span><br>     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<span class="line"><!---->     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<!----></span><br>     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<span class="line"><!---->     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<!----></span><br>     8:      if (id == -1)<span class="line"><!---->     8:      if (id == -1)<!----></span><br>     9:          return;<span class="line"><!---->     9:          return;<!----></span><br>    10:      String value =<span class="line"><!---->    10:      String value =<!----></span><br>    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate->SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<span class="line"><!---->    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate-&gt;SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<!----></span><br>    12:          (candidate->SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate->SdpMLineIndex())<span class="line"><!---->    12:          (candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex())<!----></span><br>    13:                                      : "null") +<span class="line"><!---->    13:                                      : "null") +<!----></span><br>    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate->Candidate());<span class="line"><!---->    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate-&gt;Candidate());<!----></span><br><br>When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <span class="line"><!---->When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <!----></span><br><br>In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<span class="line"><!---->In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<!----></span><br>In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<span class="line"><!---->In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<!----></span><br>Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>### --no-sandbox poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<!----></span><br>ASAN information Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->ASAN ==26232==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br><br>A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: &lt;Copy from: 'about:version'&gt;  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<span class="line"><!---->I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<!----></span><br><br>I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<!----></span><br><br>tommi@: can you please take a look at this? Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<span class="line"><!---->While executing the attached PoC testcase on Windows 10 x64 machine with ASAN enabled, Chrome crashes inside TrackAddIceCandidate from PeerConnectionTracker. Snippet of this function is as follows:<!----></span><br><br>     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<span class="line"><!---->     1:      void PeerConnectionTracker::TrackAddIceCandidate(<!----></span><br>     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<span class="line"><!---->     2:          RTCPeerConnectionHandler* pc_handler,<!----></span><br>     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<span class="line"><!---->     3:          RTCIceCandidatePlatform* candidate,<!----></span><br>     4:          Source source,<span class="line"><!---->     4:          Source source,<!----></span><br>     5:          bool succeeded) {<span class="line"><!---->     5:          bool succeeded) {<!----></span><br>     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<span class="line"><!---->     6:      DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_THREAD(main_thread_);<!----></span><br>     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<span class="line"><!---->     7:      int id = GetLocalIDForHandler(pc_handler);<!----></span><br>     8:      if (id == -1)<span class="line"><!---->     8:      if (id == -1)<!----></span><br>     9:          return;<span class="line"><!---->     9:          return;<!----></span><br>    10:      String value =<span class="line"><!---->    10:      String value =<!----></span><br>    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate->SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<span class="line"><!---->    11:          "sdpMid: " + String(candidate-&gt;SdpMid()) + ", " + "sdpMLineIndex: " +<!----></span><br>    12:          (candidate->SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate->SdpMLineIndex())<span class="line"><!---->    12:          (candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex() ? String::Number(*candidate-&gt;SdpMLineIndex())<!----></span><br>    13:                                      : "null") +<span class="line"><!---->    13:                                      : "null") +<!----></span><br>    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate->Candidate());<span class="line"><!---->    14:          ", " + "candidate: " + String(candidate-&gt;Candidate());<!----></span><br><br>When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <span class="line"><!---->When setting up an WebRTC session ,function, `AddIceCandidate` is used to add Interactive Connection Establishment candidates, recieved from the remote peer over signaling channle, to browser's ICE agent. <!----></span><br><br>In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<span class="line"><!---->In the supplied PoC , before adding an ICE candidate, garbage collection is forced to mark objects which can later be used because of active Promise that was called before garbage collection.<!----></span><br>In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<span class="line"><!---->In between triggering garbage collection and function causing the reuse, allocated memory is accessed thanks to Promise using function `setLocalDescription`.<!----></span><br>Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Function `setLocalDescription`  changes the local description associated with the connection which marks parts of the memory to be collected by garbage collector. Same marked memory is accessed during execution of `AddIceCandidate` which constitutes a use after free vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<span class="line"><!---->With proper manipulation of Promise that is responsible for setting description `setLocalDescription` this vulnerability could lead to control over freed memory and ultimately arbitrary code execution.<!----></span><br><br>### Crash Information<span class="line"><!---->### Crash Information<!----></span><br><br>Command line :<span class="line"><!---->Command line :<!----></span><br>    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.exe --js-flags=" --expose-gc"  --no-sandbox poc.html<!----></span><br>ASAN information Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->ASAN information Windows 10 x64<!----></span><br><br>    =================================================================<span class="line"><!----> 0x0003385fea80 sp 0x0003385feac8<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: use-after-poison on address 0x7ef84e666428 at pc 0x7ff654dd0a45 bp 0x0003385fea80 sp to use and restart external symbolizer!<span class="line"><!---->    ==26232==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<!----></span><br>        #0 0x7ff654dd0a44 in went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>### Summary<span class="line"><!---->### Summary<!----></span><br><br>A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->A use after free vulnerability exists in the WebRTC functionality of Google Chrome 91.0.4472.114 (Stable) and 93.0.4575.0 (Canary). A specially crafted web page can trigger reuse of previously freed memory which can lead to arbitrary code execution. Victim would need to visit a malicious website to trigger this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: &lt;Copy from: 'about:version'&gt;  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: OS X 10.14.6<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<span class="line"><!---->I'm personally unable to repro this right now due to my own Windows env's issue, so I'm just assuming this works.<!----></span><br><br>I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a UaF in the renderer [1], so treating it as such. If this is in the browser, this will need to jump up to Security_Severity-Critical.<!----></span><br><br>tommi@: can you please take a look at this?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Marcin! The VRP Panel had decided to award you $22,000 for this report.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a>
